cc8fd46b-e2a1-4364-81a8-98525185b5c7.description: After attending the "The SLII® Experience" workshop the holder of this credential has achieved demonstrated knowledge transfer in the SLII model through learn and practice experiences to commence their journey to becoming a situational leader, using real life work environment examples. Specifically, this badge holder has developed the skills in developing clear and compelling goals, diagnosing the development level of the person for the goal/task and applying the matching leadership style.
cc8fd46b-e2a1-4364-81a8-98525185b5c7.name: SLII® - Trained

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended "the SLII Experience" program, completing interactive LEARN and PRACTICE activities using real life examples.  With a servant leadership mindset,  this person has learned and practiced the 3 skills of a situational leader - developing clear and compelling goals (focusing on the person and the result), diagnosing a person's development level and matching the leadership style (correct mix of direction and support) to the person's needs. .

skills.name: Ability To Recognise And Develop One's Own Leadership Style
Activities/Programs Aligning With Organization's Goals And Objectives

33b7d4c7-b0c7-40f7-b483-b698dae8b340.description: The holder of this credential has an understanding of the 4 essential conversation skills, aimed at reducing feelings of blame and judgement. They understand the shift in mind-set required to be successful in leading a team and have gained practical experience in conducting the four core conversations to effectively manage team members, influence peers, boost relationships, engagement and work well with others.
33b7d4c7-b0c7-40f7-b483-b698dae8b340.name: Frontline Leadership - Trained

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has attended either the "Blanchard Management Essentials" or Blanchard's "First-Time Manager" workshop and participated in a series of LEARN and PRACTICE activities to build confidence and competence in  the application of skill.

skills.name: Goal Setting For Achieving Peak Performance

50bfdbf8-7316-4f87-817a-33a100d77665.description: After attending the "The SLII® Experience" workshop the holder of this badge has achieved demonstrated knowledge transfer in the SLII model through learn and practice experiences to commence their journey to becoming a situational leader, using real life work environment examples. Specifically, this badge holder has developed the skills in developing clear and compelling goals, diagnosing the development level of the person for the goal/task and applying the matching leadership style.
50bfdbf8-7316-4f87-817a-33a100d77665.name: SLII® - Completed

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended "the SLII Experience" program, completing interactive LEARN and PRACTICE activities using real life examples.  With a servant leadership mindset,  this person has learned and practiced the 3 skills of a situational leader - developing clear and compelling goals (focusing on the person and the result), diagnosing a person's development level and matching the leadership style (correct mix of direction and support) to the person's needs.

The earner has completed the pre-program LAUNCH activities, completing the Leadership Behavioural Self Assessment (LBAII),  detailing their leadership style flexibility and effectiveness.  In addition, the person understands their preferred primary, secondary and developing leadership styles.

Completed all post program MASTER activities, the 12 SLII Challenges and 12 SLII Clicks elearning activities.  Through completing these activities this person has demonstrated a desire to continue their learning through implementing their SLII skills with team members. We believe this will greatly assist in achieving long term behavioural change and increasing employee engagement.

skills.name: Ability To Recognise And Develop One's Own Leadership Style
Activities/Programs Aligning With Organization's Goals And Objectives
Goal Setting For Achieving Peak Performance

ba2dc0c2-7139-4363-b096-07dfe8628882.description: The holder of this credential has an understanding of the mindset and skillset required to develop a coach relationship. A coaching mindset centres on asking more than telling, even under times of pressure. The coaching skillset is separated into 2 areas, coaching conversation skills and the coaching process. The outcome of the program is to learn and practice a contemporary approach to coaching enabling the development of a trusting coaching relationship with team members.
ba2dc0c2-7139-4363-b096-07dfe8628882.name: Coaching - Trained

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended the Coaching Essentials program, completing interactive LEARN and PRACTICE activities using real life examples.  With a servant leadership mindset,  this person has learned and practiced the mindset and skillset for a contemporary approach to coaching.  The earner has learned and practiced the 4 coaching conversation skills and the 4 coaching process steps. With real life examples used as the basis for practicing skills, the earner is set up for success.

2dc9944f-3af1-4c8f-ad93-cf55d9b8b4c7.description: The holder of this credential has successfully completed a comprehensive accreditation process and demonstrated the knowledge, skills and experience required to deliver "The SLII® Experience" program into their organisation. They have completed theoretical and practical exercises, demonstrated a deep level of knowledge of the SLII® model, utilisation of program content, including case studies, games, instruments and video to facilitate and deliver an engaging, interactive learning experience.
2dc9944f-3af1-4c8f-ad93-cf55d9b8b4c7.name: SLII® - Accredited

fb6e97ea-66b1-43f1-a8a2-d6687f4d6adb.description: The holder of this credential has an understanding of the mindset and skillset needed to become an empowered, proactive self starter. b1c9735b-3aef-4c2b-943e-c01607378687.description: The holder of this credential has an understanding of the DiSC model, understanding the patterns of people's behaviours. Firstly developing a self-awareness of their natural patterns of behaviour and how to adapt their behaviour more appropriately to meet the challenges or opportunities of any situation. The holder has gained practical experience in understanding themselves and by observing their patterns of behaviour adapting to create more open and effective relationships.
b1c9735b-3aef-4c2b-943e-c01607378687.name: DISCovering Self & Others - Completed

skills.name: Greater Self-awareness And Awareness Of Others

263092c9-5946-459c-b9cb-06dc91ea3152.description: The holder of this credential has knowledge of how to engage in conversation when challenging topics or conflicts arise so they can make informed decisions and find the best solutions, even under high pressure. The holder of this badge has learned and practice to recognise when fight-or-flight reactions prevent listening and create discomfort in others, exploring diverse perspectives and listening to contrasting views as opportunities, creating more collaborative and result in positive outcomes.
263092c9-5946-459c-b9cb-06dc91ea3152.name: Conversational Capacity - Trained

4f5cbee8-1c91-4b9a-81a1-a60708d40ef5.description: The holder of this credential has knowledge of the key factors needed to lead successful change initiatives. 528c166b-2607-44e9-abf6-b8c9980b144a.description: The holder of this credential has an understanding of the essential skills needed to conduct more effective performance conversations with their team members. They have gained insight and practical experience in applying an effective conversation framework to build confidence in better preparing and delivering positive performance conversations.
528c166b-2607-44e9-abf6-b8c9980b144a.name: Performance Conversations - Completed (Catholic Healthcare)

Earner has completed the  MASTER post-program  Challenge activity into the work environment to consolidate and sustain program learnings and shift behaviour towards long term change.

c2a0b9f7-d60c-4767-8a79-a11feaf2cc08.description: After completing Blanchard's "Team Leadership" program, the holder of this credential has now gained practical experience in applying their learnt skills and knowledge into the work environment by completing a team assessment and developing an agreed Team Charter which provides the framework for the effective and efficient operation of the team. The holder understands the current stage of team development and what the team needs to do to achieve higher performance levels
c2a0b9f7-d60c-4767-8a79-a11feaf2cc08.name: Team Leadership - Completed (Catholic Healthcare)

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has completed the five (5) pre-program LAUNCH activities.
Earner has attended Blanchard's "Team Leadership" program and participated in a series of LEARN and PRACTICE activities to build confidence and competence in the application of skill.
Earner has successfully completed all MASTER implementation and sustainability post-program activities in work environment to achieve long term behavioural change.

bff00d0f-9c0f-4c6f-8724-4a5caee61cdb.description: After attending Blanchard's "Leading People Through Change®"program, the holder of this credential has now gained practical experience in applying their learnt skills and knowledge into the work environment by demonstrating mastery level competence in successfully implementing a work place change initiative. They have demonstrated their ability to analyse the current state of change, identify critical stakeholder concerns, expand stakeholder influence and anticipate future challenges.
bff00d0f-9c0f-4c6f-8724-4a5caee61cdb.name: Change Leadership - Completed (Catholic Healthcare)

skills.name: "Communicating And Influencing Facilitating Sustainable Change Leading Change Support And Sustaining Change Processes Sustaining And Embedding Change"

86b97771-b6f2-4437-95b3-45295b03d1e4.description: The holder of this credential has an understanding of the mindset and skillset required to develop a coach relationship. A coaching mindset centres on asking more than telling, even under times of pressure. The coaching skillset is separated into 2 areas, coaching conversation skills and the coaching process. The outcome of the program is to learn and practice a contemporary approach to coaching enabling the development of a trusting coaching relationship with team members.
86b97771-b6f2-4437-95b3-45295b03d1e4.name: Coaching - Completed (Catholic Healthcare)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended the Coaching Essentials program, completing interactive LEARN and PRACTICE activities using real life examples.  With a servant leadership mindset,  this person has learned and practiced the mindset and skillset for a contemporary approach to coaching.  The earner has learned and practiced the 4 coaching conversation skills and the 4 coaching process steps. With real life examples used as the basis for practicing skills, the earner is set up for success.
The earner has completed the pre program LAUNCH activities with 3 "Coaching in the Workplace" examples to practice during the program.

The earner has completed all post program MASTER activities, the 4 Coaching Essentials Challenges.  Through completing these activities this person has demonstrated a desire to continue their learning through implementing their contemporary coaching skills with team members. We believe this will greatly assist in achieving long term behavioural change and increasing employee engagement.

b15eacfb-cf12-49b6-8424-09b8d72ce532.description: "After attending Blanchard's ""Legendary Service""program, the holder of this credential has now gained practical experience in applying their learnt skills and knowledge into the work environment by defining, implementing and championing a customer service vision and successfully taken the necessary steps to empower Legendary Service within the organisation."
b15eacfb-cf12-49b6-8424-09b8d72ce532.name: Legendary Service® Completed (Catholic Healthcare)

a6e70124-e781-4d9f-9e08-597274eb5a2c.description: After attending the "The SLII® Experience" workshop the holder of this credential has achieved demonstrated knowledge transfer in the SLII model through learn and practice experiences to commence their journey to becoming a situational leader, using real life work environment examples. Specifically, this credential holder has developed the skills in developing clear and compelling goals, diagnosing the development level of the person for the goal/task and applying the matching leadership style.
a6e70124-e781-4d9f-9e08-597274eb5a2c.name: SLII® - Completed (Virbac)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended "the SLII Experience" program, completing interactive LEARN and PRACTICE activities using real life examples.  With a servant leadership mindset,  this person has learned and practiced the 3 skills of a situational leader - developing clear and compelling goals (focusing on the person and the result), diagnosing a person's development level and matching the leadership style (correct mix of direction and support) to the person's needs.

The earner has completed the pre-program LAUNCH activities, completing the Leadership Behavioural Self Assessment (LBAII),  detailing their leadership style flexibility and effectiveness.  In addition, the person understands their preferred primary, secondary and developing leadership styles.

skills.name: Ability To Recognise And Develop One's Own Leadership Style. Activities/Programs Aligning With Organisations Goals And Objectives Communicating And Influencing

db3d7aa5-a607-422d-a511-b14cdf5243a1.description: After attending the SLII® Concepts workshop the holder of this credential has demonstrated understanding of the SLII model and the 3 skills of a situational leader. Through learn & practice experiences, the holder of this credential has developed a practical approach to leading team members and influencing peers. Specifically, they have developed skills in creating clear & compelling goals, diagnosing the development level of a person for the goal/task and applying the matching leadership style.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended the SLII Concepts program, completing interactive LEARN and PRACTICE activities using real life examples. With a servant leadership mindset, this person has learned and practiced the 3 skills of a situational leader - developing clear and compelling goals (focusing on the person and the result), diagnosing a person's development level and matching the leadership style (correct mix of direction and support) to the person's needs.

The earner has completed the pre-program LAUNCH activities, completing the Leadership Behavioural Self Assessment (LBAII), detailing their leadership style flexibility and effectiveness. In addition, the person understands their preferred primary, secondary and developing leadership styles.

Completed all post program MASTER activities, the 12 SLII Challenges and 12 SLII Clicks e-learning activities. Through completing these activities this person has demonstrated a desire to continue their learning through implementing their SLII skills with team members. We believe this will greatly assist in achieving long term behavioural change and increasing employee engagement.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended "the SLII Experience" program, completing interactive LEARN and PRACTICE activities using real life examples.  With a servant leadership mindset,  this person has learned and practiced the 3 skills of a situational leader - developing clear and compelling goals (focusing on the person and the result), diagnosing a person's development level and matching the leadership style (correct mix of direction and support) to the person's needs.

The earner has completed the pre-program LAUNCH activities, completing the Leadership Behavioural Self Assessment (LBAII),  detailing their leadership style flexibility and effectiveness.  In addition, the person understands their preferred primary, secondary and developing leadership styles.

Completed all post program MASTER activities, the 12 SLII Challenges and 12 SLII Clicks elearning activities.  Through completing these activities this person has demonstrated a desire to continue their learning through implementing their SLII skills with team members. We believe this will greatly assist in achieving long term behavioural change and increasing employee engagement.

The earner has through a 180 degree survey of direct reports and/or peers, demonstrated an overall increase in their leadership capabilities. The questions are in relation to the mindset and skillset areas covered in the program and conducted via an online confidential survey 8 - 10 weeks post program.

skills.name: Ability To Recognise And Develop One's Own Leadership Style
Activities/Programs Aligning With Organization's Goals And Objectives
Goal Setting For Achieving Peak Performance
